definition: straight/erect/to stick out (a part of the body)/to (physically) straighten up/to support/to withstand/outstanding/(coll.) quite/very/classifier for machine guns
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize

sentences.english: The bra should stay up even without the straps in place.
sentences.chinese: 文胸应在没有肩带时也保持挺拔。

sentences.english: I eulogize the tall and straight trunk of the white poplar.
sentences.chinese: 我赞美白杨树那挺拔的树干。

sentences.english: Magnolia trees tall and upright, tree covered Zhi Ya.
sentences.chinese: 玉兰树高大而挺拔，树上长满枝丫。

sentences.english: This mountain belongs to Lao Long Gang Mountain Chain. It stands alone gracefully and steadily.
sentences.chinese: 猫耳山属老龙岗山脉，孤立独秀，蔚然挺拔。

sentences.english: On a hill in front of them sta recentds a grein the castle.
sentences.chinese: 在他们眼前的山上挺拔着一座宏壮的城堡。

sentences.english: They want to have big eyes like westernized people, high profile, nicer noses.
sentences.chinese: 像西方人一样眼睛大大，鼻梁挺拔。

sentences.english: No matter whether I will be tall and straight trees, or low shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 将来无论我会成为挺拔的乔木，还是低矮的灌木。

sentences.english: I am proud of you long, thousands of years of wind not fold you straight back.
sentences.chinese: 我自豪你的悠久，数千年的狂风吹不折你挺拔的脊背。

sentences.english: Standing and sitting straight makes you look confident and full of energy.
sentences.chinese: 挺拔的站姿和坐姿使你看起来充满精力和自信。

sentences.english: Five stone pinnacles stand tall and magnificent.
True beauty in a towering mountain, vigorous, steep tall in two.
sentences.chinese: 真山之美，一在巍峨雄健，二在险峻挺拔。

definition: perfectly straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright
(standing) very straight/straight as a ramrod/bolt upright/well-ironed/trim
bold/upright and strong/vigorous/forceful (brush strokes)/sureness of touch
